is located in the heart of pheasant country, an hour north of Interstate 90, along Highway 14, also known as the "Black & Yellow Trail" ( the shortest route from Chicago and Minneapolis to the Black Hills and Yellowstone Park). 

Specifically, Miller is at the junction of Highways 14 & 45 North, halfway between the Twin Cities and the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally.  

Miller is a bustling, progressive community with agriculture as its economic base.  At an elevation of 2,647 (whatever thats worth to you) the town boasts around 1500 odd people (some are odder than others).

value: directions=North of Hwy 14 just west of Miller

content=As a locally owned mom-&-pop motel, our family is in the position to provide you and yours a unique hospitality experience you just aren't likely to find in a chain motel.  We work to create for you a refuge from the hustle and bustle of the modern world. 

Day or night, your comfort is our priority.  Whether you want to get away for a quiet weekend or visit the unique historic and scenic sights in our area, making sure you have a pleasant and restful environment at the end of the day is what we do best.

Our claim to fame is "The Best Rest for Less", partly due to our great beds, both queens and doubles.  Rooms range from quaint country cottages to 400+ sq ft handicap accessible luxury suites. 

Besides providing a friendly, clean, comfortable environment, we are pet friendly & offer at door parking w plug ins, playground & picnic area w grill, truck parking, free Wi-Fi, free local calls, a mic & fridge in every room, & for our pheasant hunters a newly remodeled bird cleaning  station & freezers.  For you with campers we also have camper hook ups.
